thread.title: Eat this: Eggs with chorizo, cheddar and ancho ketchup at Over Easy Cafe
thread.title_full: Eat this: Eggs with chorizo, cheddar and ancho ketchup at Over Easy Cafe - Chicago Tribune

author: Leah Pickett
title: Eat this: Eggs with chorizo, cheddar and ancho ketchup at Over Easy Cafe
text:
Open for breakfast, lunch and brunch Tuesday through Sunday, Over Easy Cafe is an endearing eatery in Ravenswood that's home to Chicago's crown jewel of egg dishes: the signature Sassy Eggs ($12). What makes two over-easy eggs so special? The ingredients speak for themselves. The runny yolks come on a bed of spicy pork chorizo-jalapeno-red pepper hash (yes, this is real, and it's spectacular) laden with melted cheddar cheese and artsy drizzles of ancho ketchup and sour cream. That would be enough to sell us, but add a generous dollop of guacamole, and this plate takes a turn for the legendary. Especially when loaded onto a thick slice of buttery multigrain or sourdough toast, the Sassy Eggs earn their title. 4943 N. Damen Ave. 773-506-2605, www.overeasycafechicago.com .
Leah Pickett is a freelance writer.
